author: R Sivaraman
text:
A few jumped the queue of residents, mostly women, which started forming from 4 a.m.

A huge crowd with special coupons thronged the distribution centres since early morning. A scene from Muthialpet in Puducherry on Thursday —Photo: T. Singaravelou

Confusion and chaos prevailed over the distribution of freebies such as mixers and grinders at Nellithope, Muthialpet and Kamarajar Nagar on Thursday.

A huge crowd with special coupons thronged the distribution centres since early morning following information that free mixers and grinders announced by the government would be given away.

Even as residents, mostly women, started arriving at the venue from 4 a.m. and waited in serpentine queues for the freebies, a few persons jumped the queue, triggering chaos.

The crowd surged forward pell-mell fearing that they would miss the opportunity to get the freebies and panicked that the authorities would not entertain request on any other day.

Zubuyda, a resident, said, “We came here early in the morning and stood in queue from 6.a.m., but officials started the distribution only by 10 a.m. We had to stand in scorching sun for long.”

At around 11 a.m., Chief Minister N.Rangasamy personally inspected the distribution centres and gave instructions to the officials to ensure smooth distribution.

With inadequate number of police personnel deployed at the centres, the officials had a tough time controlling the crowds.
title: Chaos at centres distributing freebies
